snippet: The Constitution does not let someone go into a public place with a legal handgun and terrify the public.
abstract: Editorial supports appeals court decision overturning a lawsuit brought by Leonard Embody, man who was stopped and searched after brandishing a loaded AK-47 pistol in a Tennessee park; notes that while Embody had a constitutional right to carry his weapon, he also gave the park ranger reasonable cause to stop and search him.
lead_paragraph: The Constitution does not let someone go into a public place with a legal handgun and terrify the public.

headline.seo: An AK-47 in a Tennessee Park
headline.main: An AK-47 in a Tennessee Park
headline.print_headline: An AK-47 in a Tennessee Park
